[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Interactive Campus Map System (ICMS) defines requirements for a mobile navigation application, ensuring real-time campus updates, intuitive user interaction, and accessibility across platforms.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ICMS supports interactive tabbed navigation, real-time updates, offline map caching, and audio-visual guidance.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ICMS integrates with campus databases for building information, announcements, and navigation services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ICMS provides a responsive UI for iOS, Android, and kiosks, supporting touch-based interactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ICMS runs on mobile devices and kiosks with internet and touch functionality.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ICMS utilizes React Native for frontend, Node.js with Express for backend, and PostgreSQL for structured data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ICMS ensures real-time updates via WebSockets and REST APIs, with offline caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ICMS optimizes data retrieval, smooth scrolling, and resource efficiency.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ICMS provides real-time campus navigation, visual markers, and audio guidance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ICMS ensures compatibility across mobile devices, kiosks, and offline use.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ICMS links to campus information systems, directories, and announcement services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ICMS enables interactive navigation, real-time updates, visual guidance, and offline campus maps.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for students, faculty, and visitors needing real-time campus guidance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Requires internet for updates; offline mode supports cached data only.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Relies on campus databases, network connectivity, and GPS-enabled devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Tabbed Navigation: UI enabling quick section switching.
Visual Markers: Icons showing key locations.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall provide a tabbed interface displaying the campus map and real-time announcements.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall retrieve and display location data from campus databases.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to scroll and zoom within the interactive map (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall display visual markers indicating buildings with available audio guides (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall include a pause/resume button for navigation continuity (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall provide a return-to-start feature for home screen access (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a responsive UI for intuitive map interaction.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update announcements without significant delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store building data, user preferences, and navigation history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure compatibility with mobile and kiosk touch interfaces.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with accessibility guidelines for visual and audio navigation aids.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall optimize data caching for offline usability.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Navigation, tabbed UI, and interactive elements validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and accessibility policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Campus navigation standards, UI best practices, and touch interaction guidelines.
